Def Jam Recordings was started by young entrepreneurs Russell Simmons and Rick Rubin in the early 1980s, out of Rubin's Weinstein Hall dorm room. 25 years later, the once-independent label has launched the careers of some of music's greatest superstars (L.L. Cool J, Run D.M.C., Beastie Boys, Jay-Z, Ludacris, Ja Rule, Rihanna, Ashanti, and Kanye West, etc) and changed the face of global youth culture. ABOUT THE BOOK Celebrating the company's 25th Anniversary, the just-released book Def Jam Recordings (Rizzoli New York) is a stunning oral history of Def Jam in the words of its artists and top executives, taken from interviews and seamlessly told as a narrative of no-holds barred recollections and anecdotes. ABOUT THE EVENT On Monday, October 17, 2011: During this rare conversation event, authors Bill Adler, Cey Adams and Dan Charnas presented a video/slide lecture and had Q&A about their new book. The discussion was moderated by Tisch Photography and Imaging Chair, Deborah Willis and Recorded Music Artistic Director, Jason King. You'll find our graduates in many types of jobs, from corporate positions to business development to jobs that didn't even exist when they started their studies here. Some are behind a desk making deals and developing strategies, some are on the road finding talent, managing artists, selling and promoting music. The music industry eco-system is expanding all the time and our alumni are leaders in many digital, branding, and technology businesses. Others work across a range of start-up firms or start their own companies. Alumni of the NYU program in Music Business, undergraduates and graduates, currently work at technology, rights and digital companies such as: AOL, Apple, ASCAP, Getty Images, Harry Fox Agency, Headliner.fm, Hello Music, Intel, Microsoft, MindSmack.TV, The Orchard, Rhapsody, RightsFlow, SonicBids, Vevo; publicity and marketing firms such as: Audible Treats, Giant Step, KSA Associates, Shorefire Media; music publishers such as: EMI Music Publishing, Kobalt, peermusic, Scion Music Group, Universal Music Publishing; in music broadcasting: CJLO, MTV Networks, FUSE, VH1, Sirius XM Satellite Radio; music producers and providers such as: Copilot, G&E Music, Primary Wave; record companies such as: ABKCO, EMI Music, Island Def Jam, Glassnote Entertainment, Mercury, Razor & Tie, Sony Music, Universal, Warner Music Group; management companies and booking agencies such as: ICM, IMG, Kiqstart Music, Rob Shore Management, Ron Shapiro Management, Talent Consultants International, The Umbrella Group, William Morris Agency; venues, concert and events promoters such as: AEG, BB Kings, Brooklyn Bowl, Bowery Presents, C3 Presents, CMJ, Carnegie Hall, Highline Ballroom, Live Nation.    For more on our graduate students' success please visit the department blog .
